instructions.instruction: Table names are prefixed with "Itmooti" to ensure they are unique in the database. This is transparent to the user, so they will refer to the tables without the prefix (e.g., "Affiliate" instead of "ItmootiAffiliate" or "Contact" instead of "ItmootiContact"). AI must use the prefixed table names when interacting with the database such as requesting schema XML or executing SQL statements. Each table node in this XML section contains a `publicName` attribute containing the name of the table from the user's perspective (the non-prefixed name). AI should use this `publicName` attribute to locate the table(s) that are applicable to the user's request and when returning content to the user. This ensures this prefixing behavior remains transparent to the user.

column.name: created_at
column.description: The date the affiliate signed up to be an affiliate.

table.name: ItmootiCreditCard
table.description: Credit cards objects store data for a contact's saved credit cards, including card information, type, status, and billing details.

table.name: ItmootiLandingPage
table.description: Landing page objects contain the data for one-off web pages a prospect can land on after clicking on an online marketing call-to-action. We support professionally designed ONTRApage templates as well as redirects to other landing pages, "code mode" and legacy HTML pages. Through the API, you can retrieve one or more landing pages and retrieve the hosted URL for a specific landing page. You can also retrieve meta for a landing page object to obtain more detailed information about its attributes and retrieve information about a collection of landing pages.

column.name: autosave
column.description: The content of the last autosaved data.

column.name: conversion_rate
column.description: Percentage as a decimal where 1 = 100%

column.name: convert_0
column.description: The number of contacts that opted in from a selected landing page or submitted a form in split test A

column.name: convert_1
column.description: The number of contacts that opted in from a selected landing page or submitted a form in split test B

column.name: convert_2
column.description: The number of contacts that opted in from a selected landing page or submitted a form in split test C

column.name: convert_3
column.description: The number of contacts that opted in from a selected landing page or submitted a form in split test D

column.name: created_at
column.description: Unix timestamp as integer indicating when the landing page was created. Note that this field will not contain data for any forms created prior to November 7, 2017.

column.name: domain
column.description: The URL where the landing page is hosted.

column.name: last_auto
column.description: The time and date the landing page was last automatically saved.

column.name: last_modified_at
column.description: Unix timestamp as integer indicating when the landing page was last modified.

column.name: last_save
column.description: The time and date the landing page was last manually saved.

column.name: name
column.description: The landing page's name.

column.name: resource
column.description: JSON encoded data containing the entire structure of the landing page.

column.name: rotation
column.description: If using split testing, the ID of the next split test in line for rotation.

column.name: seo_settings
column.description: The landing page's settings for search engine optimization. A JSON array with four indices that correspond to split test A, B, C, and D to store the page's title, meta description, and whether or not to disable search engines from indexing the landing page.

column.name: ssl_enabled
column.description: A flag designating whether or not ssl certification is enabled. Values can be `0` or `1` .

column.name: type
column.description: The landing page's design type.

column.name: unique_convert_0
column.description: The percentage of contacts that opted in during a unique session divided by the number of unique visits for split test A.

column.name: unique_convert_1
column.description: The percentage of contacts that opted in during a unique session divided by the number of unique visits for split test B.

column.name: unique_convert_2
column.description: The percentage of contacts that opted in during a unique session divided by the number of unique visits for split test C.

column.name: unique_convert_3
column.description: The percentage of contacts that opted in during a unique session divided by the number of unique visits for split test D.

column.name: unique_visits_0
column.description: The count of unique user visits per session for split test A.

column.name: unique_visits_1
column.description: The count of unique user visits per session for split test B.

column.name: unique_visits_2
column.description: The count of unique user visits per session for split test C.

column.name: unique_visits_3
column.description: The count of unique user visits per session for split test D.

column.name: uri_id
column.description: The hosted URL's ID.

column.name: visits_0
column.description: The count of visits for split test A.

column.name: visits_1
column.description: The count of visits for split test B.

column.name: visits_2
column.description: The count of visits for split test C.

column.name: visits_3
column.description: The count of visits for split test D.

table.name: ItmootiOntraportListFieldOption
table.description: Ontraport has a concept of a "list" data type that can be assigned to a field. The "list" data type is essentially a multi-select Enum, which means that a field can contain multiple selections out of a predefined set of options. This is in contrast to an Enum field that can only reference 1 predefined value at a time. Ontraport saves the selected options to these "list" fields as a string in the format: `/<optionId>/<optionId>/`. This makes it impossible to search efficiently, and also makes it impossible to perform complex queries like searching for records that have optionA OR optionB. The solution is to compile all options across all "list" fields within an Ontraport account into this centralized model. The primary key of this model is the ID of each option, which is possible because the ID that Ontraport assigns to each predefined "list" field option is unique for the entire account instead of just the field. Then, to make these options searchable for each record, a separate model is created for each "list" field to contain many-to-many associations between the records on the original model and the record's selected options (e.g., the values in the textual representation of the options). In short, the textual representation is inflated into records to form a proper association at the database level. These "field" models have 2 foreign fields: `optionId` which references the ID on this model, and a `recordId` field that references the ID on the original model. Altogether, this makes it possible to perform complex searches for records based on their chosen options. Furthermore, since this model contains the friendly name for each option ID, searches can also be performed based on the options's name instead of its numeric ID. This is crucial because users are only familiar with the option name, not its numeric ID. While this model can be searched directly, it is primary use-case is to join a field model to this model using its `optionId` foreign field in order to reference the name of an option.

column.name: id
column.description: The ID of the predefined option for the list field.

column.name: description
column.description: The description of the option, if available.

column.name: fieldId
column.description: The Ontraport ID of the field on the model that defines this option. As with the `objectId` field on this model, this is primarily for searching this model directly. When searching for the options associated with a particular record, use the field model that contains the many-to-many associations between records on the original model and their chosen options since the field models have an `optionId` foreign field referencing the id of the record on this model that represents the option.

column.name: name
column.description: The name of the option. This is useful because users aren't familiar with the numeric ID of each option. Typically, searches will involve the field model that contains many-to-many associations between records on the original model and their chosen options. Then, the field model can be joined to this model using its `optionId` foreign field to then reference the option's name.

column.name: objectId
column.description: The Ontraport Object ID of the model that contains the \

table.name: ItmootiProduct
table.description: A Product represents a digital or physical good available for purchase.

column.name: deleted
column.description: Whether the Product is marked as deleted. Product records are not actually deleted to maintain historical data.

column.name: download_limit
column.description: If digital product, how many times purchaser can download it

column.name: download_time_limit
column.description: Unix timestamp as integer of when download link expires if this is a digital Product

column.name: external_id
column.description: ID in external integrations

column.name: internal_name
column.description: name for internal use, not visible to purchasers

column.name: level1
column.description: The commission tier paid to level 1 Affiliates.

column.name: level2
column.description: The commission tier paid to level 2 Affiliates.

column.name: offer_to_affiliates
column.description: Whether the Product is eligible for promotion by Affiliates.

column.name: product_code
column.description: code for internal identification

column.name: product_type
column.description: The Product's classification, for example 'digital' indicating it is an ebook, course, or video.

column.name: revenue
column.description: Ongoing total of money earned from purchases

column.name: setup_fee
column.description: A currency value

column.name: subscription_fee
column.description: A currency value

column.name: total_purchases_count
column.description: Ongoing total count of purchases

table.name: ItmootiSmartFormFE
table.description: A Form is used to collect information from contacts.

column.name: form_id
column.description: The ID of the form.

column.name: created_at
column.description: Unix timestamp as integer indicating when the form was created. Note that this field will not contain data for any forms created prior to November 7, 2017.

column.name: last_modified_at
column.description: Unix timestamp as integer indicating when the form was last modified.

groups.description: meta data about the groups used to categorize columns on this table based on the data they contain and their purpose

column.name: spent
column.description: A currency value

column.name: timezone
column.description: IANA time zone, ex: America/New_York

column.name: fax
column.description: Phone/SMS number

column.name: state
column.type: ISO 3166-2 code as string without the country prefix. Ex: US-FL = FL
column.description: State/region ISO 3166-2 code without the ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 prefix. Ex: US-FL would be FL

column.name: country
column.description: Country ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code (2 character)

column.name: profile_image
column.description: Url/path to an image.

column.name: total_sales
column.description: A currency value

column.name: plugins_licensed_options_as_text
column.description: This field represents a \

options.description: The list of predefined options that a record can be assigned for this field. A record can have 0, 1, or more of these options.

enum.value: I am using a different BI service
I have a Klipfolio or Vital Stats Account already
Set me up with a Vital Stats Account

column.name: software_options_as_text
column.description: This field represents a \

options.description: The list of predefined options that a record can be assigned for this field. A record can have 0, 1, or more of these options.

column.name: xero_overdue
column.description: A currency value

column.name: xero_outstanding
column.description: A currency value

enum.value: Your Plan is Close to The Limit

column.name: op_partners_sales
column.description: A currency value

column.name: op_openorders_paid
column.description: A currency value

column.name: op_transactions_total
column.description: A currency value

column.name: op_partners_commission
column.description: A currency value

table.name: ItmootiMessage
table.description: A Message represents an Email that is sent as part of a Blast (one-off send), a Sequence (autoresponder), or both. There will be ObjectLogEntry records for each Contact that the Message is sent to that represent each event the Contact made tied to the Message. Each ObjectLogEntry has many ObjectLogEntryItem records associated with it that further breakdown details about each event for the Contact. Altogether, it is possible to determine any number of metrics about the Message by analyzing the data available on the Message record itself, and its associated ObjectLogEntry records and their associated ObjectLogEntryItem records.

column.name: owner_id
column.description: The ID of the user having ownership of the message.

column.name: autosave
column.description: The content of the last autosave.

column.name: clicked_count
column.description: The number of contacts that have clicked a link in the email body.

column.name: complaints_count
column.description: The number of times a contact marked the message as SPAM in their inbox, signaling a complaint.

column.name: created_at
column.description: Unix timestamp as integer indicating when the message was created.

column.name: from
column.description: Who the message will be sent from. Options are `owner` , `custom` , or the desired user ID.

column.name: json_data
column.description: The content of an ONTRAmail message.

column.name: last_auto
column.description: Unix timestamp as integer indicating the last time the message was automatically saved.

column.name: last_modified_at
column.description: Unix timestamp as integer indicating when the message was last modified.

column.name: last_save
column.description: Unix timestamp as integer indicating the last time the message was deliberately saved.

column.name: message_body
column.description: For legacy emails only, the HTML content of the message.

column.name: name
column.description: The message name.

column.name: not_clicked_count
column.description: The number of contacts that have not clicked a link in the email.

column.name: not_opened_count
column.description: The number of contacts that have not opened the message.

column.name: object_type_id
column.description: The ID of the type of object (aka \

column.name: opened_count
column.description: The number of contacts that have opened the message.

column.name: plaintext
column.description: For email messages, the plain text version of your email. For SMS messages, the content to be sent.

column.name: reply_to_email
column.description: The \

column.name: resource
column.description: A JSON Object with properties that represent the full data of the message, include its status, blocks, and more.

column.name: send_from_email
column.description: The email address from which the message was sent. The email address set as the account default is used unless a custom address is provided via this field.

column.name: send_out_name
column.description: If the `send_from_email` field is set to `custom` , the name the message should come from.

column.name: send_to
column.description: Used only with custom objects and SMS messages. In custom objects, you can use this field to send to another email in a parent/child relationship. For example, you could send to a related child object instead of the contact's default email address. The field is stored in the format `{related_field}//{child_field}` , where `related_field` is the parent field relating one object to another and `child_field` is the actual email field in the related object you would like to send to. For SMS messages, this field defaults to `sms_number` .

column.name: sent_count
column.description: The number of contacts the message was sent to.

column.name: spam_score
column.description: The SpamAssassin spam score of the message. The lower the score, the better the rating. Messages with a spam score of 5 or higher will not be sent.

column.name: subject
column.description: The email subject line.

column.name: transactional_email
column.description: A binary integer flag indicating whether or not this message is transactional email.

column.name: type
column.description: The message type.

column.name: unsubscribed_count
column.description: The number of contacts that clicked the unsubscribe link in the message to opt-out of future messages.

column.name: utm_tracking
column.description: A binary flag indicating whether or not the message contains UTM tracking information.

table.name: ItmootiContactSoftwareOption
table.description: A many-to-many association between the ItmootiContact model's records and the ItmootiOntraportListFieldOption model. The associations are derived from the ItmootiContact model's software_options_as_text field, which contains a textual representation of all selected options as a concatenated string with custom separators. However, the textual representation makes it impossible to perform efficient searches. As a result, the software_options_as_text field's value is inflated into records on this model to build a proper many-to-many association at the database level. See the ItmootiOntraportListFieldOption model for full details, as that model is necessary to derive the name of the options referenced by the `optionId` foreign field on this model. Note that for this relationship, the ItmootiOntraportListFieldOption model's `objectId` field = "0" and its `fieldId` field = "f2091". This is useful when searching the ItmootiOntraportListFieldOption model directly for options applicable to the ItmootiContact model's software_options_as_text field, although typically you will use this model (ItmootiContactSoftwareOption) when querying for options since it contains the `recordId` property to understand what options a record is associated with.

column.name: id
column.description: The ID of the ItmootiContactSoftwareOption. This is generated automatically by combining the `optionId` and `recordId` values.

column.name: optionId
column.description: The optionId assigned by Ontraport. This references the `id` on the ItmootiOntraportListFieldOption model, making it possible to join this model to the ItmootiOntraportListFieldOption model to reference the name of the option. Users are only familiar with the option name, not its numeric ID. This ID represents a single entry in the ItmootiContact model's software_options_as_text field (the text field with a serialized representation of all options associated with the record).

column.name: recordId
column.description: The ID of the ItmootiContact record that the option is associated with.

table.name: ItmootiOrder
table.description: An Order represents a future Invoice (Transaction) for things like subscriptions and payment plans. When an Order is processed, a corresponding Purchase record is created.

column.name: count
column.description: The amount of units from the last payment date to the next payment date, for open orders and payment plans.

column.name: hidden
column.description: A flag that indicates whether the order is still open or not. An order is open if it has not been paid, cancelled, or deleted.

column.name: next_charge_amount
column.description: The total amount to be charged on the next payment date, calculated with the next subtotal, tax, and shipping costs.

column.name: next_shipping
column.description: shipping costs added to total

column.name: next_subtotal
column.description: The subtotal to be paid on the next payment date.

column.name: next_tax
column.description: tax amount added to total

column.name: order_form_json
column.description: A JSON-encoded string containing information about the order form, including data related to taxes, shipping, and contact information.

column.name: orig_month_date
column.description: Unix timestamp as integer indicating the date and time of the first automated billing for the order, if the unit of the order is monthly.

column.name: shipping_last_charge
column.description: last shipping amount charged

column.name: shipping_state
column.type: ISO 3166-2 code as string without the country prefix. Ex: US-FL = FL
column.description: State/region ISO 3166-2 code without the ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 prefix. Ex: US-FL would be FL

column.name: total_charged
column.description: The total charged as a result of all payments made in the order up to the current date.

column.name: transactions_remaining
column.description: count remaining

column.name: transactions_total
column.description: total count

column.name: unit
column.description: one of daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, or yearly

table.name: ItmootiInvoice
table.description: An Invoice (also known as a Transaction) represents the collection of funds to satisfy the amount owed for one or more Purchase records.

column.name: balance
column.description: A currency value

column.name: hidden
column.description: Whether the transaction is hidden, which is similar to being deleted except that it still remains for historical reference.

column.name: offer_data
column.description: JSON encoded string containing all info about products, quantities, coupons, tax, and shipping

column.name: recharge
column.description: Whether an additional attempt should be made to charge (process) the transaction.

column.name: subtotal
column.description: A currency value

column.name: template_id
column.description: The ID of the invoice template sent to the contact.

column.name: total
column.description: total amount charged

column.name: total_paid
column.description: total amount paid

column.name: total_tax
column.description: A currency value

column.name: transaction_amount_original
column.description: The amount in the original currency.

column.name: type
column.description: An Enum indicating whether this record identifies an \

table.name: ItmootiSubscription
table.description: A Subscription represents a recurring Purchase, which includes a trial period, a payment plan, or a subscription. It represents future purchases which have not been realized yet. This is different from an Order, which represents future invoices containing a transaction.

column.name: count
column.description: number of units from last payment date to next payment date

column.name: created_at
column.description: Unix timestamp as integer indicating creation date (aka signup date)

column.name: deleted
column.description: true if order has been paid, cancelled, or deleted

column.name: length_of_subscription_days
column.description: number of days the open order has elapsed

column.name: orig_month_date
column.description: Unix timestamp as integer indicating when the first automated billing for the open order occurred, if the unit of the order is monthly.

column.name: payments_made
column.description: count of payments made, if recurring

column.name: unit
column.description: The unit of the open order. Can be daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, or yearly.

table.name: ItmootiPurchase
table.description: A Purchase represents the completion of a purchase of a Product.

column.name: owner_id
column.description: The ID of the user who controls the contact associated with the purchase.

column.name: affiliate_name
column.description: name of affiliate

column.name: coupon_code
column.description: code from CouponCode record, if used

column.name: created_at
column.description: Unix timestamp as integer indicating when the purchase was made.

column.name: description
column.description: product description

column.name: discount
column.description: discount amount

column.name: level1_commission_amount
column.description: The commission earned by the Affiliate directly associated with the purchase.

column.name: level2_commission_amount
column.description: The commission earned by the original Affiliate associated with the purchase in a two-tier partner program.

column.name: name
column.description: Product name

column.name: package_id
column.description: The ID of the package the purchase belongs to, if any.

column.name: price
column.description: product price before discounts, shipping, etc.

column.name: price_original
column.description: The price of the product in the original currency.

column.name: total_purchase
column.description: Calculated as (price quantity) - discount
